intro: Hancornia speciosa var. cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabeno beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some botanical gardens and greenhouses.
